abstract: Deaf and mute Indian woman known only as Geeta, who wandered over border into Pakistan in 2003, returns home more than decade later amid fanfare, rare political goodwill between two countries and confusion over whether her family has been identified.
lead_paragraph: Geeta, an Indian woman who is deaf and mute, wandered into Pakistan as a young girl more than a decade ago, and her return provided a public opportunity for both countries to show good will.

headline.main: India Grateful to Pakistan for Return of Geeta, Lost for Years
headline.print_headline: Lost for Years, a Woman Returns to India

snippet: Geeta, an Indian woman who is deaf and mute, wandered into Pakistan as a young girl more than a decade ago, and her return provided a public opportunity for both countries to show good will.
